intro: Cyrtandra × alata, commonly known as the hybrid Hawaiian blue ginger, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue-violet bracts that resemble petals. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial with a bushy habit and produces small, tubular flowers. Cyrtandra × alata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and coastal areas. Its unique appearance and ecological significance make it a notable species in Hawaiian flora.
